executive_summary: Manufacturers in the Paperboard Mills industry produce paperboard, an intermediate good used primarily in manufacturing cardboard boxes. Industry demand is driven mainly by consumer purchases of products that use these containers for shipping and packaging. Growing consumer spending during the period has supported industry demand and boosted revenue. Despite rising imports into the industry, which has limited the industry's overall growth, the period has supported industry demand and boosted revenue.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Online Shoppers Mitigated the Fall in Demand Amid the Pandemic
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Demand for paperboard suffered as large swaths of the global economy shut down in response to pandemic induced regulations. While demand from durable and nondurable segments plummeted, e-commerce, chemical and pharmaceutical shipments helped keep revenue afloat during the pandemic.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Stable Downstream Demand Limits Revenue Volatility
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The food and beverage sector's relative stability ensures a steady source of demand for paperboard producers, which has helped mitigate declines in other market segments.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Environmental awareness shifts preferences toward paper packaging
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Increased environmental awareness has shifted consumer preferences toward paper-based packaging.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Companies merge to benefit from climbing demand
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Some prominent players have engaged in merger and acquisition activity to increase their vertical integration.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: NEW ENTRANTS ENTER THE INDUSTRY TO SATISFY THE GROWING DEMAND FOR INDUSTRY PRODUCTS
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Growing sales and profitability for industry operators have encouraged new entrants to satisfy the growing demand.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: E-commerce will lead to higher demand for paperboard
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Consumer spending will rise, boosting demand for products packaged with industry products.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Substitute competition expected to slow due to environmental concerns
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Environmental concerns are expected to slow substitute competition.
High competition will constrain growth in product prices.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Industry profit expected to remain steady
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Larger companies expected to push profit margins higher through vertical integration.

industry_definition: This industry processes pulp, used paper and old corrugated containers (OCC) into various paperboard varieties, including unbleached and bleached packaging paperboard.

positive_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: high - steady

threats: Import penetration into the manufacturing sector

key_trends: Substitutes cause revenue volatility due to commoditized products
Consumers' environmental attitudes encourage paperboard products
Recovering economic conditions post-pandemic increased demand
E-commerce boosting demand for paperboard packaging products
Southeast's proximity to raw materials attracts mills
Downstream markets in Mid-Atlantic attract paperboard mills
Paperboard mills compete primarily on price due to commoditization
Paperboard benefits from increasingly eco-friendly manufacturing

market_segmentation.segment_description: This industry converts purchased paper, paperboard and old corrugated containers into cardboard boxes.
Companies that primarily manufacture coated or laminated paper.
Operators in this industry process paper and paperboard for various stationery products.

products_and_services.product_description: Unbleached kraft packaging and converting paperboard made from pulp that contains no less than 80.0% wood fibers produced by the sulfate process.
Manufactured from recycled fibers from various grades of paper stock.
Used to produce consumer and retail packaging.
Made from pulp containing more than 75.0% virgin wood fibers.

tier_1_buyers: Industrial Machinery & Equipment Wholesaling in the US
tier_2_buyers: Cardboard Box & Container Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Paperboard mills compete primarily on price.
Paperboard benefits from increasingly eco-friendly manufacturing processes.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Strengthening US dollar fuels wave of imports.
Continuation of free trade policies broadens the appeal for industry exports.

regulations_points.regulation_description: Relates to general industrial and manufacturing activities.
Specific provisions for airborne pollution emissions.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The industry faces high capital dependence due to reliance on machinery.

basis_points.basis_description: Industry benefits from eco-friendly manufacturing processes.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: HIGH ENERGY COSTS ARE NEEDED TO POWER MACHINES
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Utilities costs are significant for operators.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: PURCHASE COSTS HAVE JUMPED DUE TO RISING INPUT COSTS
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchase costs have risen because of input costs.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: The industry faces more capital dependence than labor
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: More reliance on machinery and equipment.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Online shopping will help mitigate input cost volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: Commoditized products are susceptible to price fluctuations.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: UNBLEACHED KRAFT PAPERBOARD WILL SEE AN ENVIRONMENTALLY FRIENDLY CHANGE

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: Most paperboard is used in consumer packaging applications.

FAQs.question: How is your company impacted by rising imports?
FAQs.answer: Indirectly impacted by offshoring in downstream industries.

FAQs.question: Has your company been exposed to volatile input prices over the past few years?
FAQs.answer: Industry is susceptible to significant input price fluctuations.
